page.title: 19Environment of Fauldhouse
page.content: grow over them. In the{villages}of{Fauldhouse}and {Longridge }there are many{open areas and fairly wide streets.Most houses have {gardens}many of them cultivated. Some of the older cottages have as much as an{acre of ground}attached to them. Traffic through {Fauldhouse }is fairly light. It consists mainly of private cars and a few buses. Through {Longridge}the traffic is heavier as many large lorries use this route to travel south to meet the {A 74 . Therefore there is little{pollution from traffic fumes. As most houses use electric or gas heating nowadays there is very little air{pollution}from smoke.
